intro: Cervicina undulata, commonly known as the wavy bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibacillaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, branching stems and tiny, bladder-like structures called pneumatocysts, which aid in buoyancy. The plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater habitats such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often clustered in dense inflorescences. Cervicina undulata plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and small invertebrates.
